Description: Lower body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; discoloured white slip; interior glazed (fired streaky red); three faded added white bands at top of sherd; exterior: part of dilute vertical stroke on left and band at bottom; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd may come from the handle zone of a chalice. Handle zones are framed by horizontal bands and typically have groups of vertical strokes on either side of the handle root. for parallels, see Lemos no. 925 from Tocra.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0928) (phase 2)
